benchmark_details.name: BRIDGING SMART METER GAPS: A BENCHMARK OF STATISTICAL, MACHINE LEARNING AND TIME SERIES FOUNDATION MODELS FOR DATA IMPUTATION
benchmark_details.overview: This paper evaluates various models for gap-filling in smart meter electricity consumption data, comparing the effectiveness of traditional statistical methods, machine learning models, and language models for data imputation tasks.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To assess whether various models are suitable for handling missing data in smart meter electricity consumption data and to explore the potential of these models for gap-filling tasks.

data.source: Public dataset of household energy consumption from London, collected through smart meters.

methodology.calculation: Each metric was computed based on the average of five runs, averaged per household and aggregated across all households.
methodology.interpretation: Models with lower error rates indicate better performance in gap-filling tasks.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: Anonymization techniques were applied to the dataset to address privacy concerns.
